title: Social Ethics
description: Examination of contemporary moral problems, solutions to these problems, and the arguments for these solutions, with emphasis on two or more of the following sample problem areas: abortion, suicide and euthanasia, capital punishment, family ethics, race relations, social justice, war, women's issues. 4 lectures. Fulfills GE C4 except for Philosophy majors. Fulfills USCP.
prerequisites: Completion of GE Areas A and C2
